{"step_by_step_thinking": "Sibilant sounds are a category of fricative consonants that are pronounced with a hissing sound. They are produced when the tongue is close to the roof of the mouth, creating a narrow channel for the air to pass through. This is not a resting position, nor an occluding position where the airflow is completely blocked. It's also not an open from resting position. It is a position between rest and occluding, where the airflow is partially blocked but not completely.", "answer_choice": "D. Between rest and occluding position"}
